page.title: 02Buildings around Turnditch
page.content: The majority of local buildings are of red brick although there are some notable exceptions. There are many buildings dating back at least in part for over 400 years. Of particular interest is the{Thatched Cottage}which is comparatively modern but contains beams obtained from the Old Dolphin Inn in Derby when part of it was demolished for a road widening scheme in the l930s. The {Flower Lilies }in Windley takes its name from medieval times.It is a large building which is at present divided into flats. Many of our older buildings , including {Turnditch Hall , }were constructed from bricks made in the now obsolete brick kilns to be found at the end of Lime Kiln Lane.
